p: 80% of COVID-19 cases are generally mild and self-limiting, and may require no treatment. Lacking licensed drugs for SARS-CoV-2, therapeutic approaches in severely ill patients are limited to supportive care and empirical use of antibiotics to prevent or treat secondary infections [ 84, 86, 161]. To provide active treatment for SARS-CoV-2, drugs potentially inhibiting viral replication are of interest ( figure 2) [ 162].
